frame.name: Improvement_or_decline
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> improves from a less desirable <fen>Prior_state</fen> to a more desirable <fen>Post_state</fen>. (Note that members of this frame marked with the semantic type "Negative" indicate deterioration.) In most cases the <fen>Prior_state</fen> and the <fen>Post_state</fen> are implicit, since the most important fact is simply that the <fen>Post_state</fen> is better than the <fen>Prior_state</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Entity">My typing speed</fex> is <t>improving</t> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">They</fex> have <t>improved</t> <fex name="Domain">in their typing</fex> <fex name="Degree">a lot</fex> .</ex> <ex>If you think <fex name="Entity">your whole life</fex> is <t>deteriorating</t> , get out your relationship !</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The object that undergoes change.
<ex><t>Improvements</t> <fex name="ent">in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Prior_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The former state of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>The prognosis has <t>improved</t> <fex name="Prior_state">from a few months of life</fex> to a median age of survival of over 20 years .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Post_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Entity</fen> following the improvement.
<ex>The prognosis has <t>improved</t> from a few months of life <fex name="Post_state">to a median age of survival of over 20 years</fex> .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the improvement occurs.
<ex>Her mood suddenly <t>improved</t> <fex name="Time">after sundown</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition:
<def-root>The rate at which the change happens.
<ex>His leadership has <fex name="rat">slowly</fex> <t>improved</t> until he has made us forget the sulky Nasser Hussian era</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the improvement, generally a description comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>).
<ex>Our major overseas markets has <t>improved</t> <fex name="man">tentatively</fex> and increased spending by consumers and government does not appear to be benefiting this .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period over which the improvement occurs.
<ex>Screwcap wine seals enable bottle maturation, one of many wine-making <t>improvements</t> <fex name="dur">over a long period of time</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of improvement that the <fen>Entity</fen> has attained.
<ex>Robert's music is <t>declining</t> <fex name="deg">further</fex> as his self-indulgence is encouraged by a small subset of fans .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The relevant dimension of improvement.
<ex>Why have n't we <t>improved</t> <fex name="dom">in our outlook</fex> ? </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event or state of affairs that brings about the improvement of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>
